title: videocontrols.xml has anonymous function event listeners that are added but never removed

sentences.text: videocontrols.xml has anonymous function event listeners that are added but never removed.
For most of these, we can simply store the bound function (created using |fnc.bind(this)|), but we will probably want something more elegant than a bunch of separate properties attached to |this|.
Let me know if you have any questions on this bug or any other bugs.
Just putting this up to get some feedback and to make sure I'm on the right track.
No tests yet, been sort of stumped on how to approach them.
David: I haven't tested this but it looks like a good approach.
Can you see about a way to reduce some of the duplication here?
Maybe we could use an object with the names of the events as the keys and the bound events as the values?
This would allow us to do a for loop over the key/value pairs in the object when doing the removeEventListener/delete pattern.
I don't think we should be worried with adding tests for this bug, but I do appreciate your attempts to add tests :)
I think I hit all of the points you outlined in this patch.
Thanks again for all your help :)
David: Nice work on the patch.
Can you make these changes and upload a new version?
nit: we can remove this empty line and some of the other empty lines that were added, just try to follow the style of the existing code.
we can use |for each (var element in this.controlListeners)| so that we don't need to have the extra line that does |var element = this.controlListeners[i];|.
> +                    // Helper function to add an event listener to the given element > +                    function addListener( elem, eventName, func ) {
Nice, I like your helper function here :)
> +                      self.controlListeners.push({ item: elem, event: eventName, fnc: func });
nit: no space between the opening and closing parenthesis in the function calls and no blank line after an opening curly brace.
Third patch, fixes styling issues mostly
Sorry about the styling, I think I fixed everything that I touched.
Third patch, fixes styling issues mostly
One last request from me, can you update your patch to have the summary and user properly set?
You can follow the first two bullet points of this blog post for help: http://blog.bonardo.net/2010/06/22/so-youre-about-to-use-checkin-needed
After you make those changes, you can request review from dolske@mozilla.com.
> +                    // Helper function to add an event listener to the given element > +                    function addListener(elem, eventName, func) {
> +                      self.controlListeners.push({ item: elem, event: eventName, fnc: func });
What if we add |func = func.bind(self)| to the helper?
That should all the callers to be simplified even more.
I'll take it either way, though.
Yea I like the idea of simplifying it even more.
I'll make the changes and submit a new patch.
Alright I moved the bind call into the helper function.
|foo.fnc| and |func| are different, you need to make sure the same reference is used in the cached object and the addEventListener.
Ah sorry about that, I think I addressed the issue now.
I think this didn't get attention because it was missing an assigned reviewer.
I've added Dolske back as the reviewer for the patch.
(Sorry, missed the initial request in general bugmail.)
>+                    // Helper function to add an event listener to the given element >+                    function addListener(elem, eventName, func) {
>+                      listeners.push({ item: elem, event: eventName, fnc: func.bind(self) });
Nit: this would be simpler as:
self.controlListeners.push({ item: elem, event: eventName, fnc: boundFunc });
Thanks for the review Dolske, I changed fnc to func so hopes that sit's better :)
I'll go out on a limb and say that that try run says checkin-not-just-yet rather than checkin-needed :)
> +                    // Helper function to add an event listener to the given element > +                    function addListener(elem, eventName, func) {
> +                      listeners.push({ item: elem, event: eventName, func: boundFunc });
I think this should be: this.controlListeners.push( ...
> +                    // Helper function to add an event listener to the given element > +                    function addListener(elem, eventName, func) {
> +                      listeners.push({ item: elem, event: eventName, func: boundFunc });
Based on all the places that addListener is called, this.controlListeners should work, but it's probably better to use |self.controlsListeners.push( ...
Alright sorry about that last patch haha.
Here is an updated patch with the correct changes.
There's no need for the |.bind(this)| in these 3 calls;
addListener() is already doing that, so boundFunc ends up being double-bound.
r+ with this change, maybe jared can just do that as he lands it?
(In reply to Justin Dolske [:Dolske] from comment #30)
> r+ with this change, maybe jared can just do that as he lands it?
Yeah, I'll make the change when I land this.
This should get merged to mozilla-central within a day or two.
Thanks Jared, looking forward to doing some more bugs :)
